metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22727 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: CakePHP is a development framework for PHP web apps. In affected versionsthe `Cake\Database\Query::limit()` and `Cake\Database\Query::offset()`methods are vulnerable to SQL injection if passed un-sanitized user requestdata. This issue has been fixed in 4.2.12, 4.3.11, 4.4.10. Users areadvised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade may mitigate this issue byusing CakePHP's Pagination library. Manually validating or castingparameters to these methods will also mitigate the issue.

criterions.comment: cakephp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
